page.title: 14FOLK CUSTOMS - RANDWICK WAP
page.content: Randwick Wap is a revival of a medieval weaving fair. Wap day is a day of general fun where people go to share in re-enactments of ancient ceremonies and also to have fun and buy from the stalls. The Mopman clears the way and the Mayor is carried shoulder-high in procession to the Mayor's Pool where he is ducked to the strains of the Mayor's Song. An even older custom of the Wap is the Cheese Rolling. It is held on the first Sunday in May, though originally on May Day. Three Cheeses are carried in the procession to the Church. They are decorated with flowers and branches. After a short service, the three Cheeses are each rolled three times in an anti-clockwise direction around the Church.
